attributes.action: Ban all non-essential and non-biodegradable single use plastic wrapping
attributes.background: Implement a prohibition on the use of non-biodegradable single-use plastic wrapping for everything except items for which there is no alternative. Reusable wrappings such as zip bags could potentially still be allowed. Obviously industry would need some years warning to adapt - period to be debated.
attributes.additional_details: Whereas it has taken mankind about 200,000 years to overrun the planet, and our heavy burning of fossil fuels about 200 years to start changing the climate, plastics have infested every part of our planet in a mere 50 years or so. They aren't going away - with the exception of some very specialised bacteria, nature cannot deal with plastics. We became the top species without them and can manage without them again; meats can once again be wrapped in greaseproof paper, etc.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban single use plastics and the unnecessary use of plastic packaging: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552450

Ban the use of plastic packaging for all non-food items: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570065

attributes.action: Reverse government decision to allow the use of bee-killing pesticides!
attributes.background:
If bees die, we die. 
Bees are essential to the natural world and now we’ve left the EU, the UK government has decided to allow the use of EU-banned pesticide Neonicotinoid Thiamethoxam on crops. This pesticide is LETHAL to bees and other pollinators. Stop the use of Neonicotinoids on crops!
attributes.additional_details: Neonicotinoids poisons the pollen, making it deadly to bees. Research suggests that the poison then moves up the food chain, killing birds as well. Neonicotinoids are banned in several countries due to links with bee deaths. Please ban the use of neonics on crops in the UK too!

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943

attributes.action: Give NHS workers a wage rise now
attributes.background: Give our NHS workers a wage rise now to show you care about what they are all going through in dealing with this pandemic.
attributes.additional_details: Our NHS workers are underpaid we all know that.  Our absolute heroes who work in this sector have a calling and aspire to help others.  For this reason, they are naturally going to be an easy target for low wages. During this pandemic they have stepped up and exceeded our expectations of them.  Please, however small, give them something.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Increase pay for all NHS staff by 15%: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565151

We should increase the pay of our NHS staff by 25%: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563356

Automatic Yearly Pay Rise For NHS Health Care Workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565256

attributes.action: Maintain former Keighley college site as a large community green space.
attributes.background: Retain the former Keighley college site as a large green space, dramatically improving arrival into the town. Offering open space to promote well being, togetherness and a sense of community. Government to recognise the site as a community space and to not allow any construction upon the site .
attributes.additional_details: The former Keighley college site is now a large green space, dramatically improving the natural landscape upon arrival into the town . The site offer a huge opportunity to breath new life into the town and to be used to promote well being, togetherness and a sense of community .The site is owned by Bradford Metropolitan Council who have minimal interest in Keighley town centre. We call for the Government to recognise the site as a community space and to not allow any construction upon the site.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local planning issues are the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

https://www.bradford.gov.uk/your-council/epetitions/epetitions/

If you want the UK Government or Parliament to take action, for example to amend the legislation and policy framework which governs planning and development decisions taken by local authorities, you could start a new petition specifically asking for that action.

attributes.action: Prioritise keyworkers being vaccinated against COVID-19
attributes.background:
If a safe vaccine against COVID-19 is available, give our keyworkers the option of being vaccinated against it first . Keyworkers include health care professionals, people working in schools, public transport, care homes etc
Keyworkers are invaluable members of society and keep the country running
attributes.additional_details: We need to prioritise people who are most at risk of contracting and/or passing on the virus due to the nature of their work bringing them into contact with many different people during the course of their working day

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/564466

attributes.action: Police Officers to be prioritised for the Covid-19 vaccination.
attributes.background: Police Officers deal with the general public on a 24 hour, 7 days a week basis which leaves them highly exposed to contracting the coronavirus.  Apart from basic PPE, there is nothing to reduce the Officers risk of becoming infected.
attributes.additional_details: I am the mother of a serving Police Officer and I am aware of some of the calls my son has to attend as a front line Officer.  I was appalled to learn that the boys and girls who are putting their lives on the line for their country every shift they attend, were not even being considered as a priority for the Covid-19 vaccination.  The Officers are as much a priority as other emergency services due to the nature of their work.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/564155

attributes.action: Leave the Christmas lights on until the end of January to cheer up Londoners
attributes.background: 2020 has been one of the most awful years in British history. The gorgeous Xmas lights have the power to make people smile, forget about troubled times, dream for a second & cheer us up. The pandemic is unfortunately far from being over but the lights are a great natural remedy against gloomy days.

rejection.details: Decisions about Christmas lights are a matter for individual local authorities and businesses, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: Keep schools OPEN during lockdown
attributes.background: To keep schools open during lockdown to protect the long term future of our children, their education and their mental well being.
attributes.additional_details: The quality of home learning does not compare to children learning in school. The missed time in education will without doubt effect their long term futures. Social isolation is not natural and how this will effect our children is not known. Furthermore many working people will struggle with childcare if children are home.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/558050

attributes.action: Allow Fishing to continue thorough the Nov/Dec Covid lockdown
attributes.background: Allow Angling/Fishing to continue through the new lockdown as an outdoor activity
attributes.additional_details: Fishing represents a huge industry in the U.K. (£4b + pa) and is our largest participation sport. Isolated and individual by its very nature, a few hours bank side is far safer than a tube journey to work, a shopping trip to Sainsbury or an 8 hour shift on a busy construction site! Sense must prevail here, for the mental and physical well being of all participants.

rejection.details:
The Government has not banned fishing in outdoor spaces during the current lockdown in England.

The Angling Trust has published guidance on what you can and can't do during the current lockdown: https://anglingtrust.net/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/Lockdown-2-What-you-can-and-cannot-do.pdf

attributes.action: Only apply Covid-19 restrictions in areas being overwhelmed by hospitalizations.
attributes.background: To encourage natural immunity, no Covid-19 restrictions should be applied unless hospitalisations are close to overwhelming local hospitals.  Where Nightingale hospitals are available, these should be used instead of local hospitals so that other ailments are not unduly impacted.
attributes.additional_details:
Policy is being decided on the basis of new cases, but the wrong problem (stopping mild illness) is being tackled. The government should focus on preventing SERIOUS illness & reducing the collateral damage to all other health problems.

If natural immunity is not built up, any vaccination programme will be severely undermined.  Current policy will prevent natural immunity forming.

Huge amounts of money were used to set up the Nightingale hospitals.  They should be used to protect the NHS!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government to take a specific action.

Hospital admissions is already one of the four indicators used by the Government to decide on lockdown restrictions: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/containing-and-managing-local-coronavirus-covid-19-outbreaks/covid-19-contain-framework-a-guide-for-local-decision-makers

It is not clear if you want the Government to impose Covid-19 restrictions in areas where hospitals have already been overwhelmed, or where it is predicted they will be. We could accept a petition calling for restrictions to only be imposed under these circumstances, but it would need to be clear in exactly what circumstances you wanted restrictions to be imposed.

Your petition also refers to encouraging natural immunity, but there is no evidence that exposure to Covid-19 results in immunity, and we cannot publish petitions that contain false or unproven statements.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550675

attributes.action: Non-transferable equal paternity and maternity leave
attributes.background:
Leave must be non-transferable between parents to normalise both men’s and women’s care-giving duties and promote wellbeing and gender equality.
When men take leave, it helps women with their jobs, improves child-father relationships and helps to create a more gender equitable future.
attributes.additional_details:
When a family decides to have a baby, a woman's life changes. Pregnancy is a challenge to her body, and breastfeeding is something that only she can do. This is nature and we can't do anything about it. 
But the following "maternity leave" time off work that seems to be standard in most families is something that society has created, and we can change it. 
Shared paternity leave is not working as most fathers choose not to take it, but it shouldn't be an option, it should be the new standard.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly how you'd like current leave entitlements to be changed. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for recreational use
attributes.background: Legalise cannabis for recreational use in a licensed premises for adults over a certain age, People shouldn’t be criminalised for using a naturally grown plant to there benefit

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Legalise medical and recreational cannabis in the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551846

Allow the British public to vote on the legalisation of cannabis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318654

attributes.action: Make businesses have family friendly working hours for parents
attributes.background: For the government to introduce family working hours that make finding childcare easier and maintaining a healthy work life balance.
attributes.additional_details: As a parent naturally we make sacrifices as a working parent we miss many important things for hearing about their day on a school pick up to tucking them into bed at night. Since becoming a parent I've had to change my job 3 times due to them changing my hours my current employer is changing my current shift of 8hrs to 12hrs meaning I along with a lot of my colleagues won't see our children for 3 days a week. Flexible working request has been refused due to business needs More help is needed.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Government isn't responsible for setting people's working hours, but we could accept a petition calling for businesses to be required to accept flexible working requests in all cases, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Open the country, stop running from a virus.
attributes.background: Look objectively at the situation.  The Governments  of this country and the media has caused this.  Panic and fear.  The virus is holding on because of all the ‘safety’ measures in place.  Return us to normal, protect the vulnerable, let Mother Nature do her job!
attributes.additional_details:
Give us the facts about this virus.  Be truthful in the number of people that have died from the virus and not attribute all deaths where they had the virus but died of other causes.  
Allow the virus to die out naturally.  
Put us in another lockdown will not work.  People will just ignore you. We have had enough.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315979

attributes.action: Exempt young children from England’s Rule of Six Coronavirus Restrictions
attributes.background:
Consider the arbitrary nature:
- Aligning across the union
- It being safe for children in schools to exceed 6
- it being acceptable for families to split & meet (e.g. 2 families of 4: 2 visit 2, the other 2 visit the other 2)
- 2 families >6 can’t meet. 6 individuals can (a greater network)
attributes.additional_details: Debate whether these inconsistencies are appropriate, proportionate and reasonable restrictions to enforce on families across England, and consider how to redress the balance to be fair to families.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550731

attributes.action: introduce a maximum fee for financial advisers for  initial and ongoing fees.
attributes.background: at present we have independent financial advisers charging a range of fees from 1-3%,tied agents charge 5%.for limited advice this is not acceptable and i want the government to protect people from being overcharged by introducing maximum fees,both initial and ongoing.
attributes.additional_details: when the review of the financial services industry was completed several years ago,the government for some unknown reason allowed tied agents/multi tied agents to charge 5% initial fees,1% ongoing fees,and as high as 6% exit fees.the majority of ifas charge between 1%-3%.the clients who are charged these fees have less choice through the restricted nature of the advice yet are charged nearly twice as much.this is completely unfair and i cannot understand why the government allowed this to happen.the number of complaints against tied agents is obviously very high and a cap on the fees would remove all these complaints and reduce compensation payments.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. While the FCA has certain rules to increase transparency around fees, the level of these is a contractual matter for financial advisors and their customers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Make drinking alcohol and using a firearm such as a shotgun a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Create legislation that prevents people using a shotgun after consuming alcoholic beverages. For example after drinking at elevenses or lunch then returning to a clay shooting ground or out in the field to be in the possession of and use a shotgun which could be highly dangerous for all involved.
attributes.additional_details: At present people regulary go shooting in the countryside, at clay shoots, game shoots and pay to do so, as part of the perceived experience often consuming alcoholic beverages at breaktimes, elevenses or a group lunch then return to shoot later in the day. Often competitive drinking is involved with hipflasks or having a "tipple". Highly dangerous, competitive nature of the sport of shooting and dangers of firearms such as shotguns leaves risk of injury likely and more serious if drinking.

rejection.details:
Under the Licensing Act 1872 and Firearms Act 1968 it is already an offence to be drunk when in possession of a loaded firearm, or to provide a firearm or ammunition to a person if there is reasonable cause for believing they are drunk.

Decisions about whether to investigate or prosecute instances of the above offences would be a matter for the police and Crown Prosecution Service, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: Implement a green recovery package
attributes.background:
Invest in:
-Clean transportation
-Renewable energy 
-Retrofit buildings to improve their energy efficiency
-Reduce waste and improve recycling
-Protect nature and wildlife and restore degraded habitats.
attributes.additional_details:
This is essential as the recovery package can either bring us closer or further away from our zero-net emissions target. It can secure our and our children's wellbeing. It can build a competitive Britain in renewable energy and transportation or see us fall behind other nations.
The Committee on Climate Change illustrated that spending on low-carbon activities would provide a bigger boost to the economy, in both the short and long term, than pursuing a traditional recovery.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: Put all monuments back that have been taken down including signage.
attributes.background: we require the government of the day to put back all monuments and signage that represent the culture and history of our nation.
attributes.additional_details: We the british people require to look at these monument that are of great value to the history of this country. Not only that but it is educational in nature to the kids of today growing up. if we carry on taking these historic figures and signs down we will be losing our culture.How can we let our country lose its culture and history.

rejection.details:
Decisions about individual historical monuments, statues, plaques and street names are a matter for the local authority in which they are located and private landowners, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you want to raise concerns about a particular historical monument or statue you should contact your local authority about this.

The Local Government Association has published an advice note to help councils work to ensure all sections of the community feel heard by decision-makers and each other: https://www.local.gov.uk/topics/community-safety/statues

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Protect all monuments and statues from being taken down: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325814

Make it a specific offence to desecrate national flags, symbols and monuments: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325545

Require referendums on the removal of historically significant statues: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326361

attributes.action: End use of the metric system and restore imperial units for weights and measures
attributes.background: Cease metrication and restore the use of imperial units in all national standards. Businesses should be required to display imperial units relating to their goods or services with metric units in brackets following and/or permitted to trade exclusively in imperial units should they choose to do so.
attributes.additional_details: Joining the EU inevitably meant that the UK had to adopt metric units of measurement and provide EU federalists with another tool to erode our national identity. This forced our Commonwealth and English-speaking trading partners to follow suit. Imperial units are just as valid and evolved naturally and are therefore superior for reasons of usability. The law must be changed so that imperial units can be restored as part of the process of rebuilding our national identity.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321478

attributes.action: Re open zoos and wildlife parks
attributes.background: Re open them after the Covid19 lockdown. They are important in conversing animals.
attributes.additional_details:
The parks can open safely and would provide a safe and welcome resource for families to enjoy after so much time in lockdown. 

The parks and zoos conserve animals without revenue they will fail and the animals may need to be put down this is awful 

We need to preserve nature and during lockdown people are even more aware of how precious wild life is. We as human needs to help animals who have not created this situation.

rejection.details:
On 10 June the Prime Minister announced that zoos would be able to reopen from 15 June: https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/pm-statement-at-the-coronavirus-press-conference-10-june-2020  

The Government's list of businesses that are allowed to open now states that outdoor areas of, zoos, safari parks, wildlife centres and other animal attractions are all allowed to open: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close-guidance  

Since you started your petition the Government has also announced £100 million rescue package for England’s zoos and aquariums: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/100-million-rescue-package-for-englands-zoos-and-aquariums

attributes.action: Change the school year to run January to December to absorb the 'lost' term.
attributes.background: Change the school year to run Jan-Dec.  Keep classes in their current year group through until December, hopefully with their same teachers.  Use Sept-Dec 2020 to even out the imbalance in education that children will have received during school closures due to covid-19. Alter holiday duration.
attributes.additional_details:
Varying educational input due to school closures means discrepancies. Reconfigure our education system to absorb the 'lost' term and change the education calendar to run Jan-Dec. 
Use Sept-Dec 2020 as the final term of this academic year. Make Christmas holidays longer to mark the change of year group. This may also slow seasonal 'flu spread naturally by reducing groups of children in enclosed spaces. Summer holidays, challenging for working parents,a long haul for lots of kids, to be shortened.

attributes.action: Discuss with hindsight and re-evaluate the reaction and measures for Covid 19
attributes.background: Discuss with hindsight, based on new information about France’s patient zero in December and China’s in November, the possibility Covid19 has circulated around undetected for months without any overwhelming of services despite the nature of the virus and no social distancing or lockdown measures.
attributes.additional_details: It’s important to work on information made available, pre-pandemic we were advised that Covid19 was not transmissible. The more we learn about how infectious the virus is and asymptomatic people are, is it not probable we have reached an earlier peak without any overwhelming of services or need for social distancing measures, considering the virus was circulating in Europe in December and no measures were in place and no travel measures still are in place. Can we re-evaluate our position now?

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302576

attributes.action: Online Shopping sites must provide full description of country of manufacture.
attributes.background:
I want government to create more manufacturing within Great Britain, to help create employment, strengthen our economy, and help raise funding to the Exchequer thus helping to keep Taxes lower.
All that can be achieved with the populace help, if they choose at point of sale where goods were made.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe this is the right and patriotic stance to follow given the ruinous nature from Covid 19 upon our economy.
It is in the countries national interest to encourage more made and bought in the United Kingdom where possible to avoid long-term recession and unemployment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317819

attributes.action: We would like the use of sky lanterns to be banned in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: We would like a complete ban on sky lanterns being released in the United Kingdom. They are a danger to wildlife, livestock, marine life and property. Part of the remains are often non-biodegradable leaving further danger to land and sea animals from ingestion or entanglement.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many bodies who would like to see this official ban in place, nature centres, marine conservationists and the RSPCA to name a few.

There is a growing online campaign by many to raise awareness of the dangers and stop the use of sky lanterns. 

The simplest solution is a Government level ban.

Thank you.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310556

attributes.action: Implement a plan to respect Nature and all its inhabitants including animals.
attributes.background:
It is evident that human society for hundreds of years has been disregarding nature by creating policies that gain us short term economic benefit by robbing the earth of its limited resources and disrespecting all other forms of life on the planet.
Scientific evidence shows we need to change policy
attributes.additional_details:
Government need to find experts in our country and set up a department/Taskforce to consider changes to our policies and attitudes not just to our environment but all forms of life that reside in our environment and see how we can align our way of living so that it is harmonious with nature.
We need to consider bringing in practices for businesses that do not damage the environment but other forms of life, respect for nature is key to  a healthy planet.
Economics with respect for nature.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand you are concerned about nature, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
                
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, or which policies you would like to change.

You may wish to sign one of these petitions:
Publish new carbon budgets linked to the Paris Agreement and Climate Change Act:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300178

Protect the Environment – support carbon neutral energy alternatives:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300000

Add Environmental Conservation to the national curriculum for all schools:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300279

Run a Public Awareness Campaign about the Climate and Ecological Emergency:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301289

attributes.action: NHS workers and Care Workers should be exempt from paying TAX for the duration.
attributes.background: All NHS, care staff etc that are putting their jobs on the line and continuing to work should be TAX exempt for the duration of this.
attributes.additional_details:
Key workers within a care setting or NHS setting are at the front of it all, risking their health and lives and living away from family to earn minimum wage and pay tax on that. 
Ask yourself, is your life worth minimum wage minus tax? 

No-one HAS to continue to work, yet people are opting to due to the nature of their job. We need to be recognised!

attributes.action: Force Insurers to cover alternative cancer treatments. Give patients freedom!
attributes.background: Push insurance companies to include alternative treatments as part of covered oncology care. They currently have a vested interest in only covering conventional treatments being the largest investors in pharmaceutical companies. This directly impacts people’s choice of treatments and healing success
attributes.additional_details: Alternative medicine is still considered outside the scope of traditional health care, many insurance companies do not cover these visits or offer limited and restricted coverage which excludes a vast number of treatments, including almost all of natural medicine. The fear of going bankrupt often forces patients to undergo treatments which are covered but are known not to be effective such as chemotherapy and radiotherapy, often doing more harm than good or cause devastating disease relapses.

rejection.details: This would be a decision for individual insurers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Ban Animal Slaughter and Animal Agriculture
attributes.background: Every year, around 77 billion innocent animals are brutally slaughtered for their meat. attributes.additional_details:
Animal welfare is not good enough. Under animal welfare, innocent animals are still abused and killed unnecessarily.

attributes.action: Stricter restrictions on businesses to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions
attributes.background: We're asking for the government to place restrictions on the most polluting UK companies to set a cap on the level of GHG emissions they can emit, depending on factors such as the size and nature of the company. If they exceed their cap, they should face some form of sanction, such as a fine.
attributes.additional_details: A study has shown that 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global greenhouse gas emissions. This means that in order to tackle climate change and save our planet, action must be taken to stop these polluting companies from further damaging the world. I believe these restrictions would be one of the most effective ways to ensure large companies finally move towards more sustainable ways of running their business, before it's too late.

rejection.details:
We understand you would like a cap on greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions to be created and for businesses to be fined if they exceed that cap. However, the UK already operates the UK Emissions Trading Scheme, which sets a maximum amount of GHG emissions businesses can emit. Businesses in sectors to which this scheme applies have to report their emissions, and there is a cost implication if they exceed the cap. You can read more about this scheme here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/participating-in-the-uk-ets/participating-in-the-uk-ets.

It's therefore not clear how the emissions cap you are proposing would differ from the existing ETS, nor to which businesses you want this new scheme to apply.

You could have a petition calling for certain changes to be made to the ETS, or for it to be replaced with a different system, so long as it was clear what those changes were or how that new system would operate.

attributes.action: Stricter laws placed on businesses to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions
attributes.background: Impose stricter laws on polluting businesses to reduce their emissions by a certain amount each year, depending on various factors such as the size and nature of each company.
attributes.additional_details: A study has shown that 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global greenhouse gas emissions. This means that in order to tackle climate change and save our planet, action must be taken to stop these polluting companies from further damaging the world. I believe stricter laws would be one of the most effective ways to ensure large companies finally move towards more sustainable ways of running their business, before it's too late.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about commercial emissions, but it's not clear what new laws you want the Government to introduce.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make period products free
attributes.background: I would like you to make period products free for any girl or woman who needs them.
attributes.additional_details: Girls and women shouldn't have to be charged for something they do not have a choice in and can't control, nor should they be charged for going through a natural process of life. Prices keep increasing, which means feminine products are becoming unaffordable for women who aren’t earning enough. Those who struggle to buy period products may have to resort to unhygienic solutions to take care of themselves.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the cost of sanitary products are a matter for manufacturers and retailers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Require sanitary products are made available in all public and workplace toilets: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606807

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to fund free sanitary products for all women and girls, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: End net zero and green levies on our energy bills.
attributes.background: Net zero is being paid for by inflating our gas and electricity bills. Wind turbines are NOT FREE. We are all paying for them. We the tax paying people were never asked if we wanted to go green.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the government to reduce our energy bills instead of throwing millions into fuel poverty by paying for expensive unreliable energy. When the wind doesn't blow and the sun has gone down renewable energy is useless. The energy we use should be reliable and cheap. Our energy should come from North Sea gas and oil and be refined here in the UK.
We also need to increase our capacity for refining gas and oil.
The transition to green energy should be natural as it gets cheaper in the future.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the cost of decarbonising the UK's electricity supply, but it's not clear exactly what changes you want the Government to make to current policy. It's not clear if you want the Government to abandon all policies to reduce carbon emissions in the UK, or just green levies on fuel.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Suspend the green levies on domestic fuel immediately: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607977

attributes.action: Require, through statute, publishers to include trigger warnings on book covers
attributes.background:
Enact legislation requiring all UK publishers to include trigger warning on books they publish. This should include (but not be limited to):-
- sexual violence/abuse/rape
- domestic violence
- racial abuse/hatred
- denigration or abuse of people within the LGBTQI+ community
attributes.additional_details: The joy of reading is often to allow oneself to escape reality, to relax, to learn and to grow. For those who have experienced trauma (particular of a violent sexual nature) this joy is immediately curtailed by the use of sexual violence as a story telling tool, causing distress that may otherwise have been avoided if a trigger warning were presented at the outset of the story or on the cover. This is not a call for censorship but simple fair warning as is applied to TV, films, games and music.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617045

Sex and periods; both are equally important and need to be treated as such

attributes.action: Classify melatonin pills as over-the-counter medication
attributes.background: I would like to suggest that pills containing small doses of melatonin (0.5 to 10 mg) that are aimed as sleeping aid should be classified as over-the-counter medication. The process of getting a prescription is very time consuming for the patients and the NHS. This is a simple solution.
attributes.additional_details: Melatonin is a natural hormone produced by the body and thus does not need to be regulated so heavily. Irregular insomnia episodes are very common but are not classified as chronic, and therefore cannot be considered for prescription. Furthermore, there is little evidence of artificial melatonin dependence, no evidence of a lethal dose and the side effects are not chronic or significant enough for the heavy regulation it has. Hence,I suggest a set of limit to 10mg for over-the-counter melatonin.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

Decisions about the classification of medicines as prescription-only or 'over the counter' are a matter for the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA), not the UK Government or Parliament. The MHRA is operationally independent from the Government.

attributes.action: Outlaw Digital Censorship of Users (by Facebook, Twitter and social platforms)
attributes.background:
Companies such as Facebook, Twitter have inappropriate leverage on what can be expressed online

Freedom of speech is a human right, it should include digital means of expression

The internet has played a big role in the spread of new ideas -- it has become a "town square" of public expression
attributes.additional_details:
Facebook and Twitter occupy the digital space. They are not necessarily superior in a particular regard but they have monopoly of users.
